title: Popstar Madonna adopts twin daughters from Africa : Celebrity, News - India Today
text:
Celebrity Popstar Madonna adopts twin daughters from Africa The singing sensation adopted four-year-old twins earlier this month from Malawi, and brought them back home to the US. IndiaToday.in | Posted by Somya Abrol A + A - Madonna with her twin daughters. Picture courtesy: Instagram/madonna 
Like her or not, you can't hate Madonna. Every once in a while, the iconic popstar does something that wins your heart over. Last week, she adopted twin daughters--Esther and Stella--from Malawi (East Africa). 
Needless to say, the singer has been overjoyed ever since because of the latest additions to her family. 
Recently, she even shared a video of her daughters singing Twinkle Twinkle Little Star. A post shared by Madonna (@madonna) on Feb 18, 2017 at 5:50pm PST 
Madonna was granted permission to adopt the four-year-old twins earlier this month, and was allowed to bring them home with her to the US while the adoption process is finalised. 
On Saturday night, Madonna posted a video to Instagram showing the girls singing along as Twinkle Twinkle Little Star was played on the piano. 
Madonna is already mother to Lorde, 19, Rocco, 15, and David Banda, 11, and Mercy, also 11, whom she adopted. 
A source told mirror.co.uk: "Madonna has a deep affiliation with Malawi and has always wanted to do what she can to help those in need. 
"Not only does she oversee her charity, she is determined to try and give its children a better life." 
It is not be the first time Madonna has adopted a child from Malawi. 
In October 2006, Madonna adopted David as she visited the country doing charity work. She returned to the country David last year so he could receive his tribal name. 
She adopted Mercy three years later.
